record.creatorPhotographer: William A. Hiltner and Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
record.description: Total solar eclipse July 9 photographed by University of Chicago astronomers and professors Hiltner and Chandrasekhar at a remote site in Manitoba, Canada, 1,200 miles north of Chicago. The camera was equipped with a 4-inch lens using a 20-second exposure, and two-thirds of the sun’s outer corona is showing. The corona extended 2,000, 000 miles beyond the surface of the sun (one forty-fifth the distance to earth).
